TopicTitle: How to right-click on a Mac in KSP?

Articles.Content:
I know that I am missing something, but I have looked through the Wiki and elsewhere and I cannot figure out how to right-click on a docking port or whatever and do something with it on my Mac.

Help please?

Edited June 30, 2013 by KeithS
Question Solved
have you tried Ctrl + click? That's usually the mac way of right clicking...
...Macs don't have a right mouse button?

They do. Some of them. It's depending on the mouse or computer model. There is also a setting somewhere in system preferences to make you able to use two fingers (on the trackpad) to right click. And else ctrl+click.

have you tried Ctrl + click? That's usually the mac way of right clicking...

The problem is with KSP is that the Ctrl key isn't usable as that is the throttle for KSP.

I figured it out and for those that are using OSX 10.8, to activate a right-click on a apple wireless mouse you need to go to the apple control panel for it.

As I have a wireless mouse, I had to activate the option marked "Secondary Click"

After that is turned on, I have to touch the upper right part of the mouse and click TWICE before the menus appear on parts.

FYI for those that need this info.

you can change it in the settings so that you can use right click

If you are using an Apple Trackpad, look in System Preferences > Trackpad and look around until you find the option to right-click with 2 fingers. Then, try pressing the trackpad with 2 fingers to right-click in KSP. If you are using an Apple Magic Mouse, just press down on the right side of the mouse. Hope this helps!
